questions.question: My grandfather ........................... at
questions.description: The simple past is used to talk about a finished event.

questions.question: The doctors said that he was ................................ on arrival.
questions.description: Dead on arrival is the correct expression.

questions.question: If she left home at six, she .............................. be here soon.
questions.description: We use should to express logical possibility.

questions.question: Whenever we meet, we ............................. politics.
questions.description: Discuss is one of those verbs that does not take a preposition.

questions.question: Have you ................................ for this drink?
questions.description: Paid is the past and past participle form of pay.

questions.question: He .............................. me a visit the other day.
questions.description: To pay a visit is to visit someone. Paid is the past form of pay.

questions.question: It took them hours to ............................ the fire in the basement.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: What a brilliant idea ................................!
questions.description: In exclamatory sentences, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: Tell me where .............................. all this while.
questions.description: In reported questions the inverted word order is used.

questions.question: You ……………………… give me my money back.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: She worked hard so that she ............................. the promotion.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, would, could or might are common in the clause introduced by so that.

questions.question: That child of ................................ has broken my window again.
